replies.body: The arguments on this thread have become circular in nature and the discussion is going nowhere constructive. As such I'm going to lock this thread. If any player has questions about a suspension on one of their accounts and is willing to have a discussion with the community, please feel free to begin a new thread. If you have any questions about this please do not hesitate to contact us in the [Boards Moderation Discord server](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/7rtKBZLi-boards-moderation-discord-verification).

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/sQqJGedI-14-day-ban-1-game-of-chat-history

> [{quoted}](name=Xidphel,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=scTzKuFd,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-08T03:09:15.171+0000)
>
>Elsa113: guys, i'm winning as soraka can ya'll plz stfu and play

>[19:09] Elsa113: i'm so done with this

> And boatload of passive-aggressive remarks.

That IS grounds for a simple punishment.
So me telling my allies what amounts to: Hey guys i'm winning as a non-meta top, let's do the best we can and win, i'm done with this negativity..... is somehow worth being punished for?

I think what the others here are trying to say is that you are **adding** to the negativity throughout this game. Instead of ignoring the negativity and moving on, you are continuing it and being negative yourself. That **is** grounds for a punishment.
So you just told me that defending myself, while doing the best i can all game long, is somehow negativity?

Stop saying that. Nobody cares that you're calling it "defending yourself". It does not matter **why** you said what you said. It only matters that you **said it**. The bottom line is there is **no** justification for **any** negativity in League **ever**. It does not matter that you were so called "defending yourself" - on top of the fact that is unnecessary as you've been explained to.

You retaliated here - and you are now trying to play the "but mom he started it" card. That does not work.

Take 2 shots when someone uses the self-defense argument.

Self defense is preventing harm from coming to you. Muting is self-defense in this case. What you're doing is retaliating.

You're judged on your behavior.

The employee seems to have already stated the same;

>Opti
you're talk ing baout everyone else
at the end of the day
you're responsible for what you say
So defending oneself is a good reason for a 14 day ban?  Even though I did the best I could all game long....

Defending yourself implies you were preventing them from attacking you. Which is what you weren't doing, you were being passive aggressive. 

Defending yourself would be muting them.
So let me get this right... if you defend  yourself (in real life, let's say), then obviously you were in the wrong to begin with? If someone breaks into your house, is that your fault?

I don't think you're getting it.

Striking/shooting/etc your attacker in real life is called self defense because you incapacitate your attacker. You prevent them from further attacking you.

You are not defending yourself by being passive aggressive the entire chat, because you're not actually defending yourself. They are still free to harass you. You're retaliating.

Defending yourself would be using the mute feature. The mute feature immediately and completely stops all harassment through the chat.
Yet I can be reported for refusing to communicate if i just mute everyone and hide my chat.  How on earth do you justify what you're saying?

Refusing to communicate has never been punishable.

Besides. Not using chat doesn't mean not communicating. League has a very functional ping tool for a large amount of the communication.
It IS and has always been punishable.  http://elohell.net/chillout/page/4442

It was revealed to be a placebo report option similar to "unskilled player". I have not seen a single person punished for "not communicating" or "unskilled player" that wasn't a ban made in error. 

I also noticed you linked a picture for a version of league that's at least a year out of date.
I think the closest we got to "refusing to communicate" was the Support Singed case.
Yeah, and I believe they reversed the ban, along with the nunu one. The system thought they were trolling (as did many of the players).
And even that is actually no longer something that is actually punished since they changed their policy.

Man you know a reported person is getting desperate when they try to bring in real-life situations into a game.

This is Riot's little world, not yours. You broke their rules, deal with it. The employee very well explained what  you did wrong. You're just stuck on "but I tried my best :(( " excuse when that's not even why you were punished at all? If you /muted all as soon as they "flamed" you, you wouldn't be banned right now! 

Also, no, you can't "defend" yourself. You also weren't "defending" yourself; you were just being a brat. You were bickering with your "flamers" which makes you a flamer also. If you _were_ defending yourself, it would be more like "I'm not trolling, I'm actually trying, bear with me" then did a /mute all. But you didn't! And that's entirely your fault. You weren't forced to reply, at all. The whole bit with "I feel obligated to tell my teammates I'm no trolling" is far from the truth, you are only obligated to try. Not to type all damn game. And yes, you can get punished for chatting it up too much. It's called [spam](http://prntscr.com/ibovky). And yes, what you were typing was spam, look at the definition I clipped with it. Your chat was [irelevant](http://prntscr.com/ibovuf), and that's very much punishable, by all means. If it isn't necessary (and no, saying you aren't trolling 2+ times is not relevant to the game.), it's punishable. Period.

I myself have been banned for 14 days and took a month off afterwards and realized how terrible I was. I was also "defending" myself against terrible meanies ;( but in the end it doesn't matter if they spammed the chat with "You're trash" over and over, while you only said "stfu", you can very much still get in trouble for that. It's actually extremely obvious to see how wrong you were if you would stop and actually comprehend what YOU did. YOU. Y O U. Not "oh but this person did this", Riot DOESN'T CARE. Neither should you. 

Take it from another person who struggled with toxicity; you're punished for a damn good reason 90% of the time. And I'll tell you this, you were indeed punished for a damn good reason. Hope this helped, if not..... Ouch.

Different methods for different scenarios, all with the same goal: to prevent harm from coming to you. The only harm you get from chat is words and muting prevents them from ever reaching you. Literally.

Defending yourself in real life is blocking the punches and kicks. The moment you swing back is retaliating and now a fight.

The breaking into house argument really isn't good. Breaking into a house involves trespassing and intent of some sort. Which hey, depending on what you do to stop them, you can be charged with excessive force.

this punishment is about you and you alone.

It is your chat (and your past behavioral history) that the system is judging for your punishment.

Their chat will be judged in the same way. So don't worry about them.

Just because you were to most positive person in a toxic environment doesn't mean you weren't toxic.

I didn't read the whole chat with the Rioter.

The ban was because you decided to use the chat function to spend all game bitching about your team banning Swain. That isn't what chat is for, and they can ban whoever they want. Just like you can take whoever you want top lane.

The reason it is a ban instead of a chat restriction is because you already had two chat restrictions.
